SENT.plain: The antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) has been related to venous and arterial thrombosis of large and small vessels
Ocular vessels can also be involved causing transient visual loss, diplopia, ischemic optic neuropathy and central artery and venous occlusion
We describe here a case of antiphospholipid syndrome with occlusion of central retinal artery and vein to call the attention to this diagnosis
